name: Translate
overview:
This class allows you interact with Google Translate API.

First, install google-cloud with npm:

$ npm install --save google-cloud

If you are running your app on Google Compute Engine, you won't need to worry about supplying connection configuration options to google-cloud— we figure that out for you.

However, if you're running your app elsewhere, you will need to provide project details to authenticate API requests.

Compute Engine

var gcloud = require('google-cloud'); var translate = gcloud.translate();

Elsewhere

var gcloud = require('google-cloud'); var translate = gcloud.translate({ projectId: 'grape-spaceship-123', keyFilename: '/path/to/keyfile.json' });

The full set of options which can be passed to google-cloud are outlined in our Authentication guide.

methods.name: Translate
methods.description:
With Google Translate, you can dynamically translate text between thousands of language pairs.

The Google Translate API lets websites and programs integrate with Google Translate programmatically.

Google Translate API is available as a paid service. See the Pricing and FAQ pages for details.

examples.caption:
Custom Translate API

The environment variable, GOOGLE_CLOUD_TRANSLATE_ENDPOINT, is honored as a custom backend which our library will send requests to.

params.name: options
params.description: • Configuration object.

params.name: options.key
params.description: • An API key.

exceptions.description: If an API key is not provided.

methods.name: detect
methods.description: Detect the language used in a string or multiple strings.

examples.caption: Detect the language from a single string input.
Detect the languages used in multiple strings. Note that the results are now provied as an array.
If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: input
params.description: • The source string input.

params.name: callback
params.description: • The callback function.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

params.name: callback.results
params.description: • If a single string input was given, a single result object is given. Otherwise, it is an array of result objects.

params.name: callback.results[].language
params.description: • The language code matched from the input.

params.name: callback.results[].confidence
params.description: • A float 0 - 1. The higher the number, the higher the confidence in language detection. Note, this is not always returned from the API.

params.name: callback.apiResponse
params.description: • Raw API response.

methods.name: getLanguages
methods.description: Get an array of all supported languages.

examples.caption: Get the language names in a language other than English.
If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: target
params.description: • Get the language names in a language other than English.

params.name: callback
params.description: • The callback function.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

params.name: callback.languages
params.description: • The languages supported by the API.

params.name: callback.languages[].code
params.description: • The ISO 639-1 language code.

params.name: callback.languages[].name
params.description: • The language name. This can be translated into your preferred language with the target option described above.

params.name: callback.apiResponse
params.description: • Raw API response.

methods.name: translate
methods.description: Translate a string or multiple strings into another language.

examples.caption: Pass a string and a language code to get the translation.
The source language is auto-detected by default. To manually set it, provide an object.
Translate multiple strings of input. Note that the results are now provied as an array.
If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: input
params.description: • The source string input.

params.name: options
params.description: • If a string, it is interpreted as the target ISO 639-1 language code to translate the source input to. (e.g. en for English). If an object, you may also specify the source language.

params.name: options.format
params.description: • Set the text's format as html or text. If not provided, we will try to auto-detect if the text given is HTML. If not, we set the format as text.

params.name: options.from
params.description: • The ISO 639-1 language code the source input is written in.

params.name: options.model
params.description: • Note: Users must be whitelisted to use this parameter. Set the model type requested for this translation. Please refer to the upstream documentation for possible values.

params.name: options.to
params.description: • The ISO 639-1 language code to translate the input to.

params.name: callback
params.description: • The callback function.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

params.name: callback.translations
params.description: • If a single string input was given, a single translation is given. Otherwise, it is an array of translations.

params.name: callback.apiResponse
params.description: • Raw API response.

exceptions.description: If options is provided as an object without a to property.
